On Sat, 17 Nov 2012 21:59:52 +0000 Colin Vipurs <zodiaczx6@...>
wrote:
> Production code may use something different for equality, eg an id
> field which makes sense for prod but that could produce false
> positives in test. 

Hm. Sounds weird if equality differs from test to production...
 
> > How would a matcher check for equality without calling equals or
> > hashCode?
> > 
> Checking each individual field. I can provide examples of necessary. 

But isn't that exactly what the equals and hashCode methods would do?

Seems to me that having these comparisons in equals and hashCode would
make for better encapsulation than opening the class to make these
fields available to a matcher.

What am I missing here?

Robert
